14
15#ifndef DNS_SECPROTO_H
16#define DNS_SECPROTO_H 1
17
18/*! \file dns/secproto.h */
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21
22#include <dns/types.h>
23
24ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
25
26isc_result_t
27dns_secproto_fromtext(dns_secproto_t *secprotop, isc_textregion_t *source);
28/*%<
29 * Convert the text 'source' refers to into a DNSSEC security protocol value.
30 * The text may contain either a mnemonic protocol name or a decimal protocol
31 * number.
32 *
33 * Requires:
34 *\li 'secprotop' is a valid pointer.
35 *
36 *\li 'source' is a valid text region.
37 *
38 * Returns:
39 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
40 *\li ISC_R_RANGE numeric type is out of range
41 *\li DNS_R_UNKNOWN mnemonic type is unknown
42 */
43
44isc_result_t
45dns_secproto_totext(dns_secproto_t secproto, isc_buffer_t *target);
46/*%<
47 * Put a textual representation of the DNSSEC security protocol 'secproto'
48 * into 'target'.
49 *
50 * Requires:
51 *\li 'secproto' is a valid secproto.
52 *
53 *\li 'target' is a valid text buffer.
54 *
55 * Ensures,
56 * if the result is success:
57 * \li The used space in 'target' is updated.
58 *
59 * Returns:
60 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
61 *\li ISC_R_NOSPACE target buffer is too small
62 */
63
64ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
65
66#endif /* DNS_SECPROTO_H */
67
